Screen.title: TopScreen
Screen.Label: ---------- Mouse Button 1 click on field to change ----------

Help.Tip: Menu allowing user choice of stored parameter defaults.
Help.Text:
pfilt3c - PROCESSDEFAULTS
Menu allowing user choice of stored parameter defaults.
 
 Default = SYSTEM
 Allowed = SYSTEM
 Allowed = PROJECT
 Allowed = USER
 SYSTEM defaults are the defaults listed in the CPS documentation.
 
 PROJECT defaults are defaults the user has saved via the Save as Project
 Default button.
 
 USER defaults are defaults the user has saved via the Save as User Default
 button.

Screen.title: pfilt3c Process
Screen.Label: Polarization filter on MC or localized K-L filter on P-wave data
NCHAN=
OPT_DATA=
NUM_ECOMP=
OPT_MUTE=
VEL_BEG=
VEL_END=
TIM_ADD=
WIN_LEN=
WIN_INC=
MWIN_NOISE=
MINOFF=
MAXOFF=
MAXSHFT=
OPT_THRESH=
THRESH=
NPT_SMOOTH=
Groundroll Filtering Option
GFILTER_TYPE=
GFREQ_LOW_NONE=
GFREQ_LOW_FULL=
GFREQ_HIGH_FULL=
GFREQ_HIGH_NONE=
Signal Filtering Option
SFILTER_TYPE=
SFREQ_LOW_NONE=
SFREQ_LOW_FULL=
SFREQ_HIGH_FULL=
SFREQ_HIGH_NONE=
Match Filtering Option
LEN_FILT=
DIAG_LOAD=

Help.Tip: Number of multi-component data.
Help.Text:
pfilt3c - NCHAN
Number of multi-component data.
 
 Default = 3
 Allowed = 1 to 5

Help.Tip: Whether to use MC data, or use P-wave data only.
Help.Text:
pfilt3c - OPT_DATA
Whether to use MC data, or use P-wave data only.
 
 Default = MCOMP
 Allowed = P_only
 If OPT_DATA = MCOMP, use multi-component data.
 If OPT_DATA = P_only, use P-wave data only.

Help.Tip: Number of energy components to construct noise model.
Help.Text:
pfilt3c - NUM_ECOMP
Number of energy components to construct noise model.
 
 Default = 2
 Allowed = 1 to NCHAN

Help.Tip: Whether use velocity, or MUTE to define starting window of noise.
Help.Text:
pfilt3c - OPT_MUTE
Whether use velocity, or MUTE to define starting window of noise.
 
 Default = VEL_BEG
 Allowed = VEL_BOTH
 Allowed = MUTE
 If OPT_MUTE = VEL_BEG, use vel_beg to compute starting window.
 If OPT_MUTE = VEL_BOTH, use vel_beg and vel_end to compute
               starting and ending windows.
 If OPT_MUTE = MUTE, use mute time as the starting window.
 VEL_BEG is the velocity of the coherent noise for starting window.
 VEL_END is the velocity of the coherent noise for ending window.
 VEL_BEG must be greater than VEL_END.

Help.Tip: Velocity that defines starting window of groundroll/noise.
Help.Text:
pfilt3c - VEL_BEG
Velocity that defines starting window of groundroll/noise.
 
 Default =  1000 m/s
 Allowed = real> 0.0
 
 Start time = (offset / VEL_BEG) + TIM_ADD.

Help.Tip: Velocity that defines ending window of groundroll/noise.
Help.Text:
pfilt3c - VEL_END
Velocity that defines ending window of groundroll/noise.
 
 Default =  700 m/s
 Allowed = real> 0.0
 
 Start time = (offset / VEL_END) + TIM_ADD.

Help.Tip: Additional time to start the window of noise in sec.
Help.Text:
pfilt3c - TIM_ADD
Additional time to start the window of noise in sec.
 
 Default = 0.0
 Allowed = real
 
 Start time = (offset / VEL_BEG) + TIM_ADD.
 End time   = (offset / VEL_END) + TIM_ADD.

Help.Tip: Length of the noise window to be filtered in sec.
Help.Text:
pfilt3c - WIN_LEN
Length of the noise window to be filtered in sec.
 
 Default = 2.0
 Allowed = real

Help.Tip: Increment of noise window in sec.
Help.Text:
pfilt3c - WIN_INC
Increment of noise window in sec.
 
 Default = 0.3
 Allowed > 0
 The window has 50% overlapped in time.

Help.Tip: Minimum length of noise model in sec.
Help.Text:
pfilt3c - MWIN_NOISE
Minimum length of noise model in sec.
 
 Default = 0.10
 Allowed > = 0
 If the computed noise model in a given window is less than MWIN_NOISE,
 this portion of the noise model is ignored.

Help.Tip: Minimum offset to compute noise model.
Help.Text:
pfilt3c - MINOFF
Minimum offset to compute noise model.
 
 Default = 0
 Allowed real

Help.Tip: Maximum offset to compute noise model.
Help.Text:
pfilt3c - MAXOFF
Maximum offset to compute noise model.
 
 Default = 1000
 Allowed > = MINOFF

Help.Tip: Maximum statics shift in sec.
Help.Text:
pfilt3c - MAXSHFT
Maximum statics shift in sec.
 
 Default = 0.05
 Allowed < = WIN_INC/4
 Maximum statics shift is used internally to align the coherent noise.
 The output data has no statics shift applied.

Help.Tip: Whether use SIG_REF, or MEDIAN to threshod noise model.
Help.Text:
pfilt3c - OPT_THRESH
Whether use SIG_REF, or MEDIAN to threshod noise model.
 
 Default = MEDIAN
 Allowed = SIG_REF
 If OPT_THRESH = MEDIAN, use median amplitude of data as reference.
 If OPT_THRESH = SIG_REF, use computed signals as reference.

Help.Tip: Multiple of median or N/S value to trigger as coherent noise.
Help.Text:
pfilt3c - THRESH
Multiple of median or N/S value to trigger as coherent noise.
 
 Default = 3.0
 Allowed = real >= 0.0
 For the SIG_REF option, the data sample is considered to be noise if the
 noise to signal ratio equals or exceeds THRESH.
 For the MEDIAN option, the data sample is considered to be noise if the
 absolute amplitude equals or exceeds THRESH times the median absolute value
 of the samples within the window of WIN_LEN.

Help.Tip: The number of points to smooth amplitude envelope.
Help.Text:
pfilt3c - NPT_SMOOTH
The number of points to smooth amplitude envelope.
 
 Default = 7
 Allowed <= 1/4 of WIN_INC in sample

Help.Tip: Type of trapezoid gfreq_uency filter to apply (if any).
Help.Text:
pfilt3c - GFILTER_TYPE
Type of trapezoid gfreq_uency filter to apply (if any).
 
 Default = ALLPASS
 Allowed = ALLPASS     (Pass all frequencies from 0.0 to Nyquist)
 Allowed = BANDPASS    (Pass frequencies from low taper to high taper)
 Allowed = LOWPASS     (Pass frequencies from 0.0 to high taper)
 Allowed = HIGHPASS    (Pass frequencies from low taper to Nyquist)
 Allowed = BANDREJECT  (Reject frequencies from low taper to high taper)
 
 In the GFILTER_TYPE descriptions below, frequency parameters are listed in
 the required order, from low frequency to high frequency.
 
 If GFILTER_TYPE=ALLPASS, then pass all frequencies from 0.0 frequency to
 Nyquist (Specification of GFREQ_LOW_NONE, GFREQ_LOW_FULL, GFREQ_HIGH_FULL, and
 GFREQ_HIGH_NONE parameters irrelevant in this case).
 
 If GFILTER_TYPE=BANDPASS, then reject between 0.0 frequency and GFREQ_LOW_NONE,
 pass between GFREQ_LOW_FULL and GFREQ_HIGH_FULL, reject between GFREQ_HIGH_NONE
 and Nyquist, with linear tapers between the pass and reject regions.
 
 If GFILTER_TYPE=LOWPASS, then pass between 0.0 frequency and GFREQ_HIGH_FULL,
 reject between GFREQ_HIGH_NONE and Nyquist, with a linear taper between pass
 and reject regions (Specification of GFREQ_LOW_NONE and GFREQ_LOW_FULL
 parameters irrelevant in this case).
 
 If GFILTER_TYPE=HIGHPASS, then reject between 0.0 frequency and GFREQ_LOW_NONE,
 pass between GFREQ_LOW_FULL and Nyquist, with a linear taper between pass and
 reject regions (Specification of GFREQ_HIGH_FULL and GFREQ_HIGH_NONE parameters
 irrelevant in this case).
 
 If GFILTER_TYPE=BANDREJECT (also known as a "NOTCH" filter), then pass
 between 0.0 frequency and GFREQ_LOW_NONE, reject between GFREQ_LOW_FULL and
 GFREQ_HIGH_FULL, pass between GFREQ_HIGH_NONE and Nyquist, with linear tapers
 between the pass and reject regions.

Help.Tip: Frequency where low frequency taper passes nothing.
Help.Text:
pfilt3c - GFREQ_LOW_NONE
Frequency where low frequency taper passes nothing.
 
 Default =  -
 Allowed = Nyquist>=real>=0.0
 For more information, see help for the FILTER_TYPE parameter.

Help.Tip: Frequency where low frequency taper passes full amplitude.
Help.Text:
pfilt3c - GFREQ_LOW_FULL
Frequency where low frequency taper passes full amplitude.
 
 Default =  -
 Allowed = Nyquist>=real>=0.0
 For more information, see help for the GFILTER_TYPE parameter.

Help.Tip: Frequency where high frequency taper passes full amplitude.
Help.Text:
pfilt3c - GFREQ_HIGH_FULL
Frequency where high frequency taper passes full amplitude.
 
 Default =  -
 Allowed = Nyquist>=real>=0.0
 For more information, see help for the GFILTER_TYPE parameter.

Help.Tip: Frequency where high frequency taper passes nothing.
Help.Text:
pfilt3c - GFREQ_HIGH_NONE
Frequency where high frequency taper passes nothing.
 
 Default =  -
 Allowed = Nyquist>=real>=0.0
 For more information, see help for the GFILTER_TYPE parameter.

Help.Tip: Type of trapezoid gfreq_uency filter to apply (if any).
Help.Text:
pfilt3c - SFILTER_TYPE
Type of trapezoid gfreq_uency filter to apply (if any).
 
 Default = ALLPASS
 Allowed = ALLPASS     (Pass all frequencies from 0.0 to Nyquist)
 Allowed = BANDPASS    (Pass frequencies from low taper to high taper)
 Allowed = LOWPASS     (Pass frequencies from 0.0 to high taper)
 Allowed = HIGHPASS    (Pass frequencies from low taper to Nyquist)
 Allowed = BANDREJECT  (Reject frequencies from low taper to high taper)
 
 In the SFILTER_TYPE descriptions below, frequency parameters are listed in
 the required order, from low frequency to high frequency.
 
 If SFILTER_TYPE=ALLPASS, then pass all frequencies from 0.0 frequency to
 Nyquist (Specification of SFREQ_LOW_NONE, SFREQ_LOW_FULL, SFREQ_HIGH_FULL, and
 SFREQ_HIGH_NONE parameters irrelevant in this case).
 
 If SFILTER_TYPE=BANDPASS, then reject between 0.0 frequency and SFREQ_LOW_NONE,
 pass between SFREQ_LOW_FULL and SFREQ_HIGH_FULL, reject between SFREQ_HIGH_NONE
 and Nyquist, with linear tapers between the pass and reject regions.
 
 If SFILTER_TYPE=LOWPASS, then pass between 0.0 frequency and SFREQ_HIGH_FULL,
 reject between SFREQ_HIGH_NONE and Nyquist, with a linear taper between pass
 and reject regions (Specification of SFREQ_LOW_NONE and SFREQ_LOW_FULL
 parameters irrelevant in this case).
 
 If SFILTER_TYPE=HIGHPASS, then reject between 0.0 frequency and SFREQ_LOW_NONE,
 pass between SFREQ_LOW_FULL and Nyquist, with a linear taper between pass and
 reject regions (Specification of SFREQ_HIGH_FULL and SFREQ_HIGH_NONE parameters
 irrelevant in this case).
 
 If SFILTER_TYPE=BANDREJECT (also known as a "NOTCH" filter), then pass
 between 0.0 frequency and SFREQ_LOW_NONE, reject between SFREQ_LOW_FULL and
 SFREQ_HIGH_FULL, pass between SFREQ_HIGH_NONE and Nyquist, with linear tapers
 between the pass and reject regions.

Help.Tip: Frequency where low frequency taper passes nothing.
Help.Text:
pfilt3c - SFREQ_LOW_NONE
Frequency where low frequency taper passes nothing.
 
 Default =  -
 Allowed = Nyquist>=real>=0.0
 For more information, see help for the FILTER_TYPE parameter.

Help.Tip: Frequency where low frequency taper passes full amplitude.
Help.Text:
pfilt3c - SFREQ_LOW_FULL
Frequency where low frequency taper passes full amplitude.
 
 Default =  -
 Allowed = Nyquist>=real>=0.0
 For more information, see help for the SFILTER_TYPE parameter.

Help.Tip: Frequency where high frequency taper passes full amplitude.
Help.Text:
pfilt3c - SFREQ_HIGH_FULL
Frequency where high frequency taper passes full amplitude.
 
 Default =  -
 Allowed = Nyquist>=real>=0.0
 For more information, see help for the SFILTER_TYPE parameter.

Help.Tip: Frequency where high frequency taper passes nothing.
Help.Text:
pfilt3c - SFREQ_HIGH_NONE
Frequency where high frequency taper passes nothing.
 
 Default =  -
 Allowed = Nyquist>=real>=0.0
 For more information, see help for the SFILTER_TYPE parameter.

Help.Tip: Number of points for the match filter.
Help.Text:
pfilt3c - LEN_FILT
Number of points for the match filter.
 
 Default = 5
 Allowed = int >= 0
 It is usually between 3 to 9 points. If the filter length is too long,
 the match filter may remove the primary events as well as noise.
 If LEN_FILT = 0, No match filter applied

Help.Tip: Diagonal load, in percent.
Help.Text:
pfilt3c - DIAG_LOAD
Diagonal load, in percent.
 
 Default = 3
 Allowed = real>=0.0
 Diagonal load helps to stablize the match filter.

Help.Tip: Button that removes this process parameter screen.
Help.Text:
pfilt3c - CLOSE
Button that removes this process parameter screen.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Appears only on the view-only process parameter screen.

Help.Tip: Button to accept parameter values, run traps and remove screen.
Help.Text:
pfilt3c - OK
Button to accept parameter values, run traps and remove screen.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that accepts parameter values, runs the parameter traps and removes
 the parameter screen.

Help.Tip: Button that accepts parameter values and runs the parameter traps.
Help.Text:
pfilt3c - APPLY
Button that accepts parameter values and runs the parameter traps.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that accepts parameter values and runs the parameter traps but does
 not remove the parameter screen.

Help.Tip: Button to remove the parameter screen without changing parameters.
Help.Text:
pfilt3c - CANCEL
Button to remove the parameter screen without changing parameters.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =

Help.Tip: Set parameters to their initial value or last applied value.
Help.Text:
pfilt3c - RESET
Set parameters to their initial value or last applied value.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that sets the parameters back to their values when the screen appeared
 or to their last applied value.

Help.Tip: Accept the current parameters and move to the previous process.
Help.Text:
pfilt3c - PROCESSLISTLEFT
Accept the current parameters and move to the previous process.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that allows the user to accept the current parameter values, run the
 parameter traps and move to the previous process in the current workfile.

Help.Tip: Menu of processes in the current workfile and their number.
Help.Text:
pfilt3c - PROCESSLIST
Menu of processes in the current workfile and their number.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Menu that allows the user to accept the current parameter values, run the
 parameter traps and move to any chosen process in the current workfile.

Help.Tip: Accept the current parameters and move to the next process.
Help.Text:
pfilt3c - PROCESSLISTRIGHT
Accept the current parameters and move to the next process.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that allows the user to accept the current parameter values, run the
 parameter traps and move to the next process in the current workfile.

Help.Tip: Save the current parameter values as Project Defaults.
Help.Text:
pfilt3c - PROJECTDEFAULT
Save the current parameter values as Project Defaults.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that saves the current parameter values as Project Defaults for this
 process.  There will be one set of Project Defaults for a project.

Help.Tip: Save the current parameter values as User Defaults.
Help.Text:
pfilt3c - USERDEFAULT
Save the current parameter values as User Defaults.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that saves the current parameter values as User Defaults for this
 process.  There will be one set of User Defaults for a userid.

Help.Tip: Allows the user to access the pop-up Help Window.
Help.Text:
pfilt3c - HELP
Allows the user to access the pop-up Help Window.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 The Help Window allows access to three kinds of help:  Parameter Help, CPS
 Process Help and Application (CFE) Help.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                         C P S   P R O C E S S
 
 Name       : PFILT3C
 Category   : filters
 Written    : 2006-10-31   by: Stephen Chiu
 Revised    : 2007-01-03   by: Stephen Chiu
 Maturity   : production
 Purpose    : Polarization filter on MC/localized K-L filter on P data
 Portability: No known limitations.
 Parallel   : Yes.
 
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                          GENERAL DESCRIPTION
 
 The polarization filter is a time-variant adaptive filter designed to remove
 coherent noise such as groundroll and reverberation on the multi-component
 (2C/3C/4C) data.  Analytic signals are first computed by combining input
 data and input data after Hilbert transform. The starting window of the
 noise model is either based on the user-defined mute or noise velocity.
 A complex SVD first transforms the data into complex eigen space.
 In general, the groundroll is a dispersive signal with approximately
 elliptical particle motion, thus the groundroll energy typically concentrates
 on the first two largest eigenvalues and eigenvectors. The groundroll noise
 model can be constructed from the first two largest eigenvalues and
 eigenvectors. The noise model is then adaptively subtracted from
 the input data. This polarization filter can be extended to P-wave data.
 For the P-wave data case, three adjacent traces can be used to simulate
 a MC data set.
 
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                            ADVICE FOR USERS
 
 For multi-component case, input data consists of a gather of traces in a
 single receiver station. For example of a 3C recording, the input gather
 consists of 3 traces, one P-wave trace and 2 shear-wave traces. The P-wave
 trace should be the first trace and followed by shear-wave traces within
 the gather. The BUNCH process can be used to combine 3C traces into a gather.
 
 For P-wave data, the input data consists of a gather with a number
 (usually 3) of adjacent traces. For the 3D data, it is recommended
 to perform noise attenuation on the receiver-line domain and the entire
 3D volume is processed through receiver line by receiver line.
 At the end of each receiver line, it may not have enough traces to form a
 complete gather. For example, we define a complete gather to have 3 traces
 and may have 1 or 2 traces at the end of the receiver line, the program
 automatically accounts for this case. The BUNCH process can be used to
 combine a number of adjacent traces into a gather with HONOR_HDR = yes,
 and HDR_TO_HONOR = receiver line number.
 
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                             REVISION HISTORY
 
      Date         Author    Description
      ----         ------    -----------
 1.  2007-01-03   S.Chiu     Created original version.
 
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
